books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: Allan Quatermain Stories
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A collection of short stories about a legendary hunter.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: The Merchant of Venice
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: To help his friend Bassanio woo the beautiful Portia, the Venetian merchant Antonio borrows a large sum from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.

books.title: The Winter’s Tale
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A king’s unfounded jealousy destroys his family and kingdom.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: His Masterpiece
books.author: Émile Zola
books.summary: A groundbreaking painter struggles to leave his mark on the bohemian art world of 19th-century Paris.

books.title: The Vampire
books.author: John William Polidori
books.summary: A London gentleman goes on an ill-fated trip with a mysterious and sinister newcomer.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.

books.title: Tusculan Disputations
books.author: Cicero
books.summary: Cicero gives practical guidance for living wisely and well by adopting a Stoic outlook and concentrating on the virtues.

books.title: Gudrun
books.author: Anonymous
books.summary: A princess is captured by a jealous prince from a rival kingdom.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: A collection of Selma Lagerlöf’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
